page.title: 02Farming around Strensall
page.content: We have visited several farms in our D-block situated at 60.5,60.2. 63.3, 60.85. 63.05,61.2. 63.05,60.9. From these we have discovered that the {average farm}has 156 acres and employs 2 workers. The number of employees has fallen over the last 20 years,due to {new farming methods and mechanization. Most are{mixed,arable and stock farms growing Winter cereals,sugar-beet and fodder-beet.They also grow grass which is made into hay or silage.Most of these crops are used for winter feed . the land is rich in phosphate there fore little is added.Other fertilizers used are nitrogen and potash.Stock is bought and sold at{York Livestock {Centre}but one farmer visits 83 different markets stretched over the UK.The cost of a calf ranges from Â£8O to Â£16O.A bull Â£1,000 to Â£10,000. Tractors range from Â£14,000 to Â£40,000
